columns.name: LEG_GID
columns.description: The GID for the itinerary leg related to the capacity override.

columns.name: CAPACITY_OVERRIDE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the capacity override details related to this itinerary leg. The capacity override allows you to model specific weight/volume restrictions by transport mode or equipment that can be assigned to any itinerary leg to control whether a shipment can be planned for that leg. For example, some countries or regions have specific capacity restrictions such as bridges that have maximum weight limits. By creating a capacity override and assigning it to a specific itinerary leg, Oracle Transportation Management will override the equipment capacity. For example, if an equipment has a capacity of 30000 pounds, but the capacity override says 27000 pounds, then the system will not plan more than 27000 pounds in the equipment.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.
